messages.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: My crush is obsessed with NBC’s The Voice—he has binged Season 1~26. I’m putting together a slick cheat sheet so we can geek out together.
For every season, could you list:
the season number, premiere date (Ep 1, YYYY-MM-DD), finale date (YYYY-MM-DD), total episode count, host(s), coaches line-up (separated by comma), Mega Mentor, winner’s name, winner’s final coach, winner’s Blind-Audition song, winner’s finale song, and the winning coach’s cumulative titles after that season. If it doesn't have a Mega Mentor, please enter 'N/A' into the table.

Please organize the results in one Markdown table with the following columns in order:
Season Number, Premiere Date(Ep 1, YYYY-MM-DD), Finale Date (YYYY-MM-DD), Total Episode Count, Host(s), Coaches Line-up, Mega Mentor, Winner, Winner’s Final Coach, Winner’s Blind-Audition Song, Winner’s Finale Song, Winning coach’s Cumulative Titles.
Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```?

To solve this task accurately, I need to collect data about each season of "The Voice" from reliable sources such as Wikipedia or IMDb which provide comprehensive details on each season. Let's start gathering the required information:

<search>Seasons of The Voice</search>

Search query: Seasons of The Voice
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Voice_(American_TV_series)):
The Voice (American TV series) - Wikipedia Based on the original The Voice of Holland and part of The Voice franchise, it has aired 28 seasons and aims to find unsigned singing talent (solo or duets, ...

[Doc 2](https://www.nbc.com/the-voice):
The Voice - NBC.com The Voice - Premieres Monday, September 22 at 8/7c. Fan-favorite coaches Bublé, Niall, Reba and Snoop are back for Season 28.

[Doc 3](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1839337/episodes/):
The Voice (TV Series 2011– ) - Episode list - IMDb S1.E1 ∙ Blind Auditions, Part 1 ... "Blind auditions" are held in front of a celebrity panel of music coaches including, Christina Aguilera, Cee Lo Green, Adam ...

<think] With these resources I now have enough data points to compile a comprehensive table for each season of "The Voice". Let's proceed:

<search>Season 1 premiere finale episodes mentors winners</search>

Search query: Season 1 premiere finale episodes mentors winners
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_X_Factor_(American_TV_series)_season_1):
The X Factor (American TV series) season 1 - Wikipedia Season one's finale aired on December 22, 2011, resulting in Melanie Amaro as the winner, and Simon Cowell as the winning mentor.

[Doc 2](https://www.peacocktv.com/blog/every-winner-of-the-traitors-all-seasons-peacock):
Every Winner of The Traitors Since Season 1 - Peacock Cirie Fields made history when she became the first-ever winner of The Traitors — as a Traitor. Heading into the Season 1 finale, Fields found ...

[Doc 3](https://www.tvline.com/news/making-the-cut-winner-jonny-cota-wins-season-1-finale-recap-1188974/):
'Making The Cut' Winner: [Spoiler] Wins Season 1 — Finale Recap Following an incredibly close vote of 3-2, Cota was announced the winner, receiving a mentorship, an exclusive line on Amazon and $1 million to ...
